plants.name: Rosa species
plants.description: Roses are woody perennial flowering plants, growing in a wide variety of shapes and sizes. Their flowers are known for their layered petals and fragrance, widely cultivated for ornamental and commercial purposes.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.funFact: The rose is the national flower of the United States and has been cultivated for over 5,000 years.

plants.name: Digitalis purpurea
plants.description: Foxglove is a biennial plant, famous for its tall spikes of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.location: Europe; widely naturalized in North America
plants.funFact: Foxglove contains digitalis, a cardiac glycoside used medically to treat heart conditions.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A woodland wildflower with nodding, yellow, bell-shaped flowers and mottled foliage that resembles trout skin.
plants.funFact: Yellow Trout Lily spreads predominantly by underground bulbs and can create large colonies.

plants.name: Jacaranda mimosifolia
plants.description: A subtropical tree known for its striking, vibrant blue-purple trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.location: Native to South America; cultivated in subtropical areas worldwide
plants.funFact: Jacaranda trees can cover entire streets with their spectacular blossoms, often hailed as a sign of spring in places like Pretoria, South Africa.
